Method Detail

onHeartRateEvent

void onHeartRateEvent(java.lang.Integer heartRate,
                      java.lang.Integer averageHeartRate,
                      java.lang.Integer maxHeartRate,
                      java.lang.Integer heartRateZone)
A heart rate event with data. All units are in bpm. Receiving this data requires that the user have a heart rate monitor connected to the MMF app in their Android phone. You can check if heart rate is available using the onStartWorkoutEvent(Boolean metric, Boolean hasHeartRate, Boolean calculatesCalories, Boolean isSpeed) listener when the app starts.

Parameters:
heartRate - the heart rate of the user in beats per minute.
averageHeartRate - the heart rate of the user in beats per minute.
maxHeartRate - the heart rate of the user in beats per minute.
heartRateZone - the heart rate of the user. This Integer varies between 1 and 5. Heart rate zones are calculated using the heart rate and the max heart rate of the user, which depends on their age.

onCadenceEvent

void onCadenceEvent(java.lang.Integer cadence,
                    java.lang.Integer averageCadence,
                    java.lang.Integer maxCadence)
Candence data. All units are in Revolutions Per Minute. Like Heart Rate, it requires a device be attached to the phone reading the data. At this time the only way to know if it is available is to check for data in this method.

Parameters:
cadence - current cadence in rpm
averageCadence - average cadence in rpm
maxCadence - max cadence in rpm

onCalorieEvent

void onCalorieEvent(java.lang.Integer calories)
Total calories burned burned so far in the workout. Units are in kcals. To calculate calories the MMF apps need certain user information, which we may or may not have. Like Heart Rate, you can check if is available using the onStartWorkoutEvent(Boolean metric, Boolean hasHeartRate, Boolean calculatesCalories, Boolean isSpeed) listener when the app starts.

Parameters:
calories - total calories burned so far in kcals.

onDistanceEvent

void onDistanceEvent(java.lang.Double distance)
Total distance travelled so far during the workout. Units are in meters.

Parameters:
distance - meters traveled.

onDurationEvent

void onDurationEvent(java.lang.Long duration)
Total duration of the workout so far. Units are in milliseconds.

Parameters:
duration - of workout in milliseconds

onSpeedEvent

void onSpeedEvent(java.lang.Double speed,
                  java.lang.Double averageSpeed,
                  java.lang.Double maxSpeed)
Speed of workout. Units are in meters per second. Speed can be used to calculate Pace if the user desires it. The onStartWorkoutEvent(Boolean metric, Boolean hasHeartRate, Boolean calculatesCalories, Boolean isSpeed) command will say whether the user has chosen to see speed, or if this is an activity (like cycling) where speed should be displayed, as opposed to pace which is the norm for running. Regardless this callback will always receive speed, so it is up to the client UI to change it based on the user's preferences.

Parameters:
speed - current speed in meters per second
averageSpeed - average speed of workout in meters per second
maxSpeed - max speed of workout in meters per second

onPowerEvent

void onPowerEvent(java.lang.Integer power,
                  java.lang.Integer averagePower,
                  java.lang.Integer maxPower)
Power Power data. All units are in watts. Like Heart Rate, it requires a device be attached to the phone reading the data. At this time the only way to know if it is available is to check for data in this method.

Parameters:
power - current power in watts
averagePower - average power in watts
maxPower - max power in watts
